{
    "title": "Balm",
    "category": "Lips",
    "brand": "Huda",
    "tags": "special",
    "color":["64496bdeaa32ea1a72830ad4","64496bf4aa32ea1a72830ad8"],
    "description": "Moisturizers are an essential part of every skin-care routine, Shereene Idriss, MD, a board-certified dermatologist at Union Square Laser Dermatology in New York City, tells Allure. Just as our bodies require us to hydrate with water, so does our skin.",
    "price": "1500",
    "quantity": "100"
}

{
    "title": "Eye Cream",
    "category": "Eyes",
    "brand": "Estee Lauder",
    "tags": "special",
    "description": "Go for a retinol or a peptide-packed eye cream. Retinol and retinoid are vitamin A derivatives that stimulate skin cell turnover and collagen production. “Retinol helps with overall texture and goes deeper into skin structures to revitalize wrinkles and improve the appearance of fine lines,” says Green.",
    "price": "800",
    "quantity": "5"
}

{
    "title": "Lips Moisturizing Balm",
    "category": "Lips",
    "brand": "Maybelline New York",
    "tags": "special",
    "description": "Some lip balms can definitely leave your lips feeling dry and chapped, but as long as you pay attention to formulas and use the right products, lip balm can be a great tool for keeping your lips moisturized, hydrated, and happy.",
    "price": "200",
    "quantity": "4"
}
